reaction.name: Grounding Bolts
entries: When the golem takes lightning damage, it gains temporary hit points equal to the damage it takes. As part of the same reaction, a creature within 30 feet of your golem must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your artificer spell save DC or take lightning damage equal to the temporary hit points gained. On a success, the creature takes half as much lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Emergency Shield
entries: At level 15 you further improve your ability to harness the remaining energy of your spells. You start the day with 3 stored charges and the maximum you can reach increases to 8, although you still cannot spend more than 5 at a time on a skill.
Once per turn you can use any number of charges you want to do the following effects:

items: Now as long as you have the temporary hit points of this feature, you gain resistances to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage. {@condition resistence} if you have spent a minimum of 3 charges in the reaction.

entries: At 9th level, you learn to use the energy of your spells, transforming it into energy that you can use in combat. You can use your bonus action to consume a spell slot gaining a number of charges equal to the level of the spell, you can store a number of charges equal to 5.
Once per turn you can use any number of charges you want to do the following effects:

items: When you receive damage, you can use your reaction consuming at least one charge, with which you are covered by number of temporary hit points equal to half your artificer level **rounded up**. You can choose to use more charges, for each extra charge you consume you add your PB to the temporary hit points. If you consume at least 3 charges you also add your Intelligence modifier once.

optionalfeature.name: Shield of the Guardian
entries: With a shield that has this infusion on your turn as a bonus action, you anchor next to your shield in the position you are in, your movement speed is reduced to 0, your shield stops applying AC and in return any creature that you you choose within 10ft behind of you receives the half cover effects until the beginning of your next turn. You can use this upgrade a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus and its uses recharge after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Shield
entries: This shield is worn on the arm like a bracelet. It can be activated and deactivated with an object interaction this will count as don and doff your shield making your hand free. While it is active you can use your reaction to add your Intelligence modifier to your AC for the triggering attack. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus and its uses recharge after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Paralyzing blow
entries: When you hit with an attack you can use the amount of charges you want to power your attack, you do an extra 1d8 lightning damage for each charge you consume. If you use at least 3 charges you force the creature to make a Strength saving throw against your artificer spell DC. On a failed save, the creature is prone {@condition prone} and receives the damage. On a successful one, it does not suffer any effect but it receives the damage. If you use the 5 charges the creature makes the seving throw with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Assisted Strike
entries: With a bonus action, you energize your weapon using at least one charge to make it extremely precise, on your next attack you add a +2 bonus to the attack, for each extra charge you use you add an extra +1 to the attack. If you spend 5 charges you make the attack with advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Contained Energy
entries: When making a skill check that uses a physical stat **strength, dexterity, constitution** you can use your reaction to spend at least one charge to add half of your PB **rounded up** to the skill check per charge consumed.

optionalfeature.name: Expandable Range
entries: As a bonus action you can expand the range of your weapon by 5 feet. Additionally, as an action you can force all creatures you choose within 10 ft of you to make a Dexterity saving throw against your artificer spell DC. On a failed save, they receive a number of d6 equal to your PB + intelligence modifier of the weapon damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus and its uses recharge with after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Capture System
entries: Using this infusion, you can choose an additional macabre module to upgrade your composite golem when you finish a long rest. It gains the benefit of this module until you use this infusion again to choose a different module.
Starting at 9th level, you can choose two additional macabre modules to your composite golem when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Tools
entries: This magic tool kit grants a +2 bonus to ability checks that add proficiency with the tool kit to the roll.
This bonus increases to +3 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Portable Focus
entries: The weapon you carry can be used as an arcane focus. Additionally, once per day you can use the weapon's accumulated energy to cast a spell without the need for verbal or somatic components.

optionalfeature.name: Reinforced structure
entries: Once per turn when you hit with an attack, you can activate this effect, you do an extra d4 of weapon damage and you also force whoever you hit to make a Strength saving throw against your artificer spell DC. On a successful save, it doesn't suffer any effect, and on a failed one, you choose between:

items: Reduce its speed by half.
Push it 10 ft.
entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus and its uses recharge after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Normal infusions
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can add the following properties to any melee weapon or shield as long as it is magical or you apply an artificer infusion to it. The properties are divided into special and common infusions, a different type of artificer infusion, you can distribute them as you want as long as you do not exceed the maximum total of modifications. Furthermore, infusions cannot be repeated in any weapon.

items: Light: An easy-to-use light weapon, making it ideal for fighting with 2 weapons **Cannot be infused if the weapon has the heavy property**

Thrown: A weapon with this infusion gives you the ability to make a ranged attack at the ranges of **15/30**. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon.
Magnetism: As an action you can cause the weapon to return to your hands with this property, as long as it is on the same plane of existence as you.
Versatile: You have the ability to use this weapon two-handed and increase the damage die **A d4→d6→d8→d10→d12**. **Cannot be used if the weapon has the light or two handed property**.
Storm Engine: You can change your weapon's damage to lightning when making an attack but before knowing the result of the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Trigger device
entries: You install an ammunition trigger of any type on your weapon, you can change your attacks for those of this new weapon.

items: Weapon,  Range. A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range

Firearm, 1d4 piercing, Ammunition. You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition, up to a maximum of 6 bullets, after that the weapon must be reloaded with the Loading property

20/60 ft. Special: You can use ammunition of any type (arrows, sling bullets, or firearm bullets) the weapon converts them into useful ammunition and if you have the magic stone cantrip you can infuse 3 ammunition that becomes a d6 + Intelligence modifier and has a range of 60 ft, Loading. Because of the time required to load this weapon you need an action, reaction or bonus action to reload.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Enhancement
entries: During a long rest, you can store a number of vials equal to you PB to store in your weapon, once per turn when you hit an enemy you can choose to spend one of the stored vials.
You can spend a number of vials equal to your PB for long rest.

entries: Surgeons tools include scalpels, syringes, a vial of mild sedative, three rolls of gauze, and a bonesaw. These tools weigh 5 lbs and cost 25 gp.

subclassFeature.name: Reanimator Spells
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Reanimator Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Macabre Modules
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can upgrade your composite golem in your idle time. When you finish a long rest, choose two macabre modules from the list below. Your golem gains the benefit of these modules until you use this feature again. Starting at 9th level, you can choose three macabre modules when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Adamant Staples
entries: Your composite golem's weapon attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistances. In addition, the golem has resistance to damage from critical hits.

entries.name: Beastial Components
entries: Your composite golem incorporates animal components to enhance its abilities. While this module is installed, your golem's base movement speed increases by 10 feet, it has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) ability checks that rely on scent, and it has darkvision out to a distance of 120 feet.

entries.name: Electric Touch
entries: Your composite golem can cast the {@spell shocking grasp} cantrip. When it casts this cantrip, it uses your spell attack modifier, counts as your level for the purposes of the cantrip's damage scaling, and scores a critical hit on a result of 19 or 20 on the attack roll.

entries.name: Growth Hormone
entries: Your composite golem's size increases to Large. Its maximum hit points increase by 2 per level you have in this class.

entries.name: Iron Knuckles
entries: When your composite golem hits a creature with a slam attack, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw with a DC of your artificer spell save DC or be pushed 5 feet or knocked {@condition prone} (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Spark of Life
entries: Starting at 15th level, your understanding of the role that electricity has in starting and stopping life has led to improved outcomes. When you cast an artificer spell that restores hit points or deals lightning damage, roll {@damage 2d6} and add the result to the amount healed or lightning damage dealt by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Reanimate Dead
entries: At 9th level, you always have the {@spell animate dead} spell prepared and can cast it without expending a spell slot. It counts as an artificer spell for you and does not count against the maximum number of spells you can prepare. When you cast the spell, the creature type of the skeletons or zombies created changes from undead to construct and has resistance to lightning damage.
Once you cast this spell without expending a spell slot, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

In addition, whenever you create a construct with a spell, one can be created with a macabre module of your choice. Only one construct other than your Composite Golem can have a macabre module at any given time.

subclassFeature.name: Enlivening Discharge
entries: At 5th level, when your composite golem is within 60 feet of you, you can use an action to fire a bolt of empowering energy at it. When you do, it gains the following benefits for the next minute:

items: It gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
It regains a number of hit points equal to your Proficiency Bonus at the start of each of its turns.
Its slam attack deals an additional {@damage 1d10} lightning damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Modern Prometheus
entries: Your transgressive experiments with life after death have borne fruit, and you have created a composite golem. It's friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See its game statistics in the {@creature Composite Golem|ASDFS} stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. Your composite golem is covered in the stitches and staples necessary to keep the various body parts it's composed of attached to one another.

In combat, the golem shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the golem can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.

If the {@spell mending} spell is cast on it, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If it has died within the last hour, you can use your surgeon's tools as an action to revive it, provided you are within 5 feet of it and you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. The golem returns to life after 1 minute with all its hit points restored.

At the end of a long rest, you can create a new composite golem if you have surgeon's tools and spare parts with you. If you already have a golem from this feature, the first one immediately perishes. The composite golem also perishes if you die.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item surgeon's tools|ASDFS}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

Energy contained: Now if you spend at least 3 charges, you add your proficiency bonus to the roll once again whether or not you are proficient in the skill. This modification cannot be used if you already have expertise.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Reanimator
entries: Most artificers prefer to work with chemicals or metals, but you work with flesh and bone. Other artificers are known to push boundaries in pursuit of magical advancement, but you transgress even those limits. These differences have resulted in your unique ability to manipulate the states of life and death. Others may believe these states are static, but to a reanimator they are dynamic—what is living may die, and what is dead may live again.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Master
entries: A weapons master is a type of craftsman who masters forging and the complexity of arcane engineering to break out of the molds of normal weapons and create truly unique works of engineering, capable of things that other weapons cannot.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Training
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and when you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Master Spells
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Machine Cultist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you can prepare.
